intro: Sarcomphalus mistol, commonly known as the mistol plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is valued for both its ornamental and medicinal properties.
